wikipedia_page.main: George Mason (1735 – 1806) was an English writer and book collector.

response: George Mason IV (1725–1792) was an early American planter and statesman, considered one of the "Founding Fathers" of the United States.
George Mason may also refer to:
*George Mason I (1629–1686), early American colonist and statesman
*George Mason II (1660–1716), early American planter and statesman
*George Mason III (1690–1735), early American planter and statesman, father of George Mason IV
*George Mason (writer) (1735–1806), English writer and book collector
*George Mason V (1753–1796), early American planter and militiaman
*George Mason VI (1786–1834), prominent American planter
*George Mason (actor), New Zealand actor who appeared in 50 Ways of Saying Fabulous and other films
*George Mason (footballer, born 1896), who played for Leeds United in the 1920s
*George Mason (footballer, born 1913), who played for Coventry City in the 1930s and 1940s
*George Mason (racing driver) (1890–1918), early American racing driver
*George Mason (rugby league), Australian rugby league footballer and coach
*George Mason (bishop) (died 1783), Anglican clergyman
*George Mason (priest) (died 1562), Canon of Windsor
*George Mason (24 character), a fictional character in American television series 24
*George Mason, Virginia, a census-designated place in Fairfax County, Virginia, USA
*George Mason University, a public university in Fairfax County, Virginia
*George Mason University School of Law
*George Mason Patriots, NCAA sports teams from George Mason University
